intro: Diphasiastrum digitatum, commonly known as the starry false spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers that are surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia, a common feature in the Euphorbiaceae family. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Diphasiastrum digitatum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
